meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Laura Bulkin Francisco Maldonado-Ramirez Balaji Narain Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6231.

div.div: Alex introduces the newly unveiled Jeopardy! Hall of Fame backstage.

td.p: Laura Bulkin, a pianist and music teacher from Taos, New Mexico
Francisco Maldonado-Ramirez, a legislative aide from Highland Park, New Jersey
Balaji Narain, an attorney originally from Cumming, Georgia (whose 1-day cash winnings total $35,400)

tr.td: (Alex: And yes, you're going to have to spell the correct response.)
(Sarah: ...from north to south--specialties just like mama made them at a 42,000-square-foot marketplace in New York City.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'About its eruption in 79 A.D., an observer wrote that "broad sheets of fire and leaping flames blazed at several points"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: About its eruption in 79 A.D., an observer wrote that "broad sheets of fire and leaping flames blazed at several points"

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_5_1', 'clue_J_5_1_stuck', '(Francisco: What is Whip?)
(Alex: You have to spell it.)
(Francisco: Oh--what is--W-H-I-P?)
(Alex: No. Balaji.)
(Balaji: What is W-I-P-P?)

W-I-P

BalajiFranciscoLaura
')

Parmesan cheese comes from the northern Italian city of Parma, where the whey from cheese making is fed to the local pigs, helping create another famous local product, this')

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents the clue from Eataly in New York.) Parmesan cheese comes from the northern Italian city of Parma, where the whey from cheese making is fed to the local pigs, helping create another famous local product, this

$10,400

$5,401
Phoenix, Arizona')
